solution_line_template: The first bed is {first_bed_length} feet long by {first_bed_width} feet wide so it's {first_bed_length}*{first_bed_width} = <<{first_bed_length}*{first_bed_width}={area_first_bed}>>{area_first_bed} sq ft

She's building {num_first_type_beds} beds that are this size so that's {num_first_type_beds}*{area_first_bed} = <<{num_first_type_beds}*{area_first_bed}={total_area_first_type}>>{total_area_first_type} sq ft of growing space

The second bed is {second_bed_length} feet long by {second_bed_width} feet wide so it's {second_bed_length}*{second_bed_width} = <<{second_bed_length}*{second_bed_width}={area_second_bed}>>{area_second_bed} sq ft

She's building {num_second_type_beds} beds that are this size so that's {num_second_type_beds}*{area_second_bed} = <<{num_second_type_beds}*{area_second_bed}={total_area_second_type}>>{total_area_second_type} sq ft of growing space

The smaller beds are {total_area_first_type} sq ft and the larger beds are {total_area_second_type} sq ft for a total of {total_area_first_type}+{total_area_second_type} = <<{total_area_first_type}+{total_area_second_type}={total_growing_space}>>{total_growing_space} sq ft of growing space
